suitability_reason: Gnomes and Dwarves (especially gnomish “Tinker” subraces) excel as artificers due to their craftsmanship traditions. Warforged or Autognomes also fit the class (being constructs), as do humans (Mark of Making).

prominent_continents.reason: arcane towns favor tinkering and alchemy

suitability_reason: Hardy, tribal races tend toward the barbarian path. Goliaths and Dwarves commonly channel rage into battle (notably Zealot or Berserker paths). Half-Orcs and Dragonborn (storm- or giant-descended) also make fierce barbarians.

Bards come from musical/storytelling peoples. Dwarves have a strong bardic tradition (music and storytelling); Dragonborn also inspire through epic tales. Gnomes (creatives and lore‑keepers), Half-Orcs (tribal storytellers), and Changelings (natural actors) are likewise common bards.

prominent_continents.reason: trade hubs favor diplomats and orators
urban cults of ancestry and spirits
dwarven martial tradition with singsong morale

suitability_reason: Clerics often mirror their race’s deities or traditions. Dwarves are known for Forge and Knowledge clerics (Moradin’s faith). Dragonborn frequently become devoted clerics of Bahamut or Tiamat. Gnomes produce Nature or Arcana clerics (forest vs. tinker gnomes). Half-Orcs may be combat priests of war gods.

prominent_continents.reason: populous faiths tending the cycle of life
shady coastal cults and fey mischief
militarized heavy faith and frontier defense

suitability_reason: Druids fit nature‑bound races. Forest Gnomes especially produce Druids (shapeshifters of fox, badger, etc.). Dwarves may be Mountain Druids (venerating creation). Half-Orcs sometimes lean into Circle of the Moon (wild heart). Lizardfolk often have shamanistic Druids in swamp tribes.

prominent_continents.reason: wild fungal growth and decay cycles

races.name: Elf
races.continent_reason: forest cycles of burn and regrowth

prominent_continents.reason: elemental hotspots that foster wildfire rites
urban infernal users with volatile magic

suitability_reason: Warriors are common among sturdy races. Dwarves are famed as “undisputed best warriors” (often Battle Masters), and Half-Orcs train in all arms. Dragonborn pride themselves on martial skill. Gnomes who fight often take Eldritch Knight paths.

races.name: Githyanki
races.continent_reason: planar warriors drawn to Kuriguer magic

prominent_continents.reason: disciplined martial orders and honor codes

suitability_reason: Disciplined cultures and outcasts often become monks. Dwarves commonly become Monks (especially Drunken Masters). Half-Orcs can be grim monks (battle or shadow styles). Changelings use the Monastic path to master identity and form.

races.name: Githzerai
races.continent_reason: psionic enclaves attracted to wild magic

prominent_continents.reason: communal revelry and informal martial tradition

suitability_reason: Paladins often come from oaths-driven races. Dwarven Paladins (Oath of Devotion) are iconic; Dragonborn Paladins (Bahamut’s champions) are common. Gnomes may become zealous Paladins (obsessively devoted). Half-Orcs may swear oaths to atone or protect.

prominent_continents.reason: strong martial orders and conquest ethos

suitability_reason: Wilderness guardians appear among many races. Dwarven rangers (Gloom Stalkers) safeguard the Underdark. Gnomes use rangers to guard enchanted forests. Orcs have tribal scouts and beast-masters. Lizardfolk excel as swamp hunters (rangers).

prominent_continents.reason: rural communities keep beasts as partners

races.name: Goliath
races.continent_reason: mountain hunters of titans and beasts

prominent_continents.reason: fey and nature swarms common in woods

suitability_reason: Stealthy roles suit curious or cunning races. Dwarven scouts/assassins are elite rogues. Gnomes’ inquisitiveness yields many rogues. Half-Orcs often become brutal enforcers or assassins. Kenku naturally fall to thievery; Lizardfolk rogues sneak in swamps; Changelings make excellent spies.

Innate spellcasters often come from magical lineages. Dwarves have many Wild Magic and Divine Soul sorcerers. Dragonborn frequently have Draconic or Divine bloodlines. Forest Gnomes, touching fey magic, often manifest Wild Magic. Half-Orcs may bear unpredictable arcane marks. Changelings adopt sorcerous powers into their personas.

prominent_continents.reason: outsider minds attracted to wild magic
mixing of lineages creates chaotic sorcery

suitability_reason: (No official lore; suggestions include highly intelligent or psionic races.) Possible fits: Grandmaster (Elf, Human), Mentalist (Kalashtar, Githyanki), Scholar (Vedalken, Gnome), War Mind (Orc, Goliath).

Arcane scholars often come from inquisitive cultures. Gnomes eagerly become wizards; Dwarves, valuing craftsmanship, train Evokers/Abjurers. Dragonborn devote themselves to arcane mastery. Hobgoblins select bright youth as war-magic wizards. Changelings with transmutation magic hide in personas.

races.name: Kalashtar
races.continent_reason: psionic dreamers susceptible to alien pacts

races.name: Elf
races.continent_reason: elven courts tied to fey lords

races.name: Half-Elf
races.continent_reason: border folk drawn into fey bargains

prominent_continents.reason: fey courts and bargains dominate the woods
temptations and infernal bargains in cities

suitability_reason: Arcane scholars often come from inquisitive cultures. Gnomes eagerly become wizards; Dwarves, valuing craftsmanship, train Evokers/Abjurers. Dragonborn devote themselves to arcane mastery. Hobgoblins select bright youth as war-magic wizards. Changelings with transmutation magic hide in personas.

races.name: Gith
races.continent_reason: planar scholars attracted to gravitic study
